name: Titanium.Android.RemoteViews
doc:
@platform android 1.6 @editurl https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/edit/master/apidoc/Titanium/Android/RemoteViews.yml

The Titanium binding of Android RemoteViews.

@description

RemoteViews is an API for referencing and updating a remote view hierarchy that lives in another process, for example, in a Notification.

To create a remote view hierarchy, you must define an Android XML layout for the views you want to display, and place the XML file in the platform/android/res/layout inside your project folder. See the examples for a sample XML layout and sample code for creating a remote view.

To use a remote view hierarchy in a notification, see Notification.contentView.

Because the remote view hierarchy belongs to another process, you cannot call methods on it directly, but you can call methods on the RemoteViews object to update views in the heirarchy by ID. To reference a view inside the layout, use the Titanium.App.Android.R object to reference the view's ID. For example, if you have a view with the ID notify_imageview, you can refer to it using:

Ti.App.Android.R.id.notify_imageview

See also:

  • RemoteViews in the Android Developer Reference.

  • XML Layouts in the Android Developer Guide.

Examples

Create a Remote View

The following code excerpt creates a RemoteViews object based on a custom layout called custom_layout.xml, and set a label's text.

var AppR = Ti.App.Android.R;
var customLayout = Ti.Android.createRemoteViews({ layoutId: AppR.layout.custom_layout });
customLayout.setTextViewText(AppR.id.custom_text, "Click Me!");

This example uses a simple custom layout:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
        android:layout_width="fill_parent"
        android:layout_height="fill_parent"
        android:orientation="vertical" >
    <TextView android:id="@+id/custom_text"
            android:layout_width="fill_parent"
            android:layout_height="fill_parent"
            android:background="#ffffff"
            android:textColor="#aaff0000"
            android:textStyle="italic"
            android:gravity="center"
            android:text="Hello, I am a TextView" />
</LinearLayout>

The layout file for this example must be placed in platform/android/res/layout/custom_layout.xml.

property.name: apiName
property.doc:
The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to.

@description

The value of this property is the fully qualified name of the API. For example, Button returns Ti.UI.Button.

@platform android 3.2.0 @platform blackberry 3.2.0 @platform iphone 3.2.0 @platform ipad 3.2.0 @platform mobileweb 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to. ...

property.name: bubbleParent
property.doc:
Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent.

@description

Some proxies (most commonly views) have a relationship to other proxies, often established by the add() method. For example, for a button added to a window, a click event on the button would bubble up to the window. Other common parents are table sections to their rows, table views to their sections, and scrollable views to their views. Set this property to false to disable the bubbling to the proxy's parent.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0
property.shortDoc: Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent. ...

property.name: layoutId
property.doc:
Android layout resource ID for the view to display. Required.

@description

To define a custom layout resource in your application, the XML layout file should be placed in platform/android/res/layout folder inside your project folder.

Use Titanium.App.Android.R to reference the ID of the layout.
property.shortDoc: Android layout resource ID for the view to display. ...

property.name: lifecycleContainer
property.doc:
The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy.

@description

If this property is set to a Window or TabGroup, then the corresponding Activity lifecycle event callbacks will also be called on the proxy. Proxies that require the activity lifecycle will need this property set to the appropriate containing Window or TabGroup.

@platform android 3.6.0
property.shortDoc: The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy. ...

property.name: packageName
property.doc: Package name that the resource ID lives in. Optional.
property.shortDoc: Package name that the resource ID lives in. ...

method.name: addEventListener
method.doc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the event.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to invoke when the event is fired.

method.shortDoc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...

method.name: applyProperties
method.doc:
Applies the properties to the proxy.

@description

Properties are supplied as a dictionary. Each key-value pair in the object is applied to the proxy such that myproxy[key] = value.

params.name: props
params.doc:
A dictionary of properties to apply.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform blackberry 3.3.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0 @platform mobileweb 3.0.0

method.shortDoc: Applies the properties to the proxy. ...

method.name: fireEvent
method.doc: Fires a synthesized event to any registered listeners.

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the event.

params.name: event
params.doc: A dictionary of keys and values to add to the Titanium.Event object sent to the listeners.

method.shortDoc: Fires a synthesized event to any registered listeners. ...

method.name: getApiName
method.doc: Gets the value of the apiName property.
method.shortDoc: Gets the value of the apiName property. ...

method.name: getBubbleParent
method.doc: Gets the value of the bubbleParent property.
method.shortDoc: Gets the value of the bubbleParent property. ...

method.name: getLayoutId
method.doc: Gets the value of the layoutId property.
method.shortDoc: Gets the value of the layoutId property. ...

method.name: getLifecycleContainer
method.doc: Gets the value of the lifecycleContainer property.
method.shortDoc: Gets the value of the lifecycleContainer property. ...

method.name: getPackageName
method.doc: Gets the value of the packageName property.
method.shortDoc: Gets the value of the packageName property. ...

method.name: removeEventListener
method.doc:
Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

@description

Multiple listeners can be registered for the same event, so the callback parameter is used to determine which listener to remove.

When adding a listener, you must save a reference to the callback function in order to remove the listener later:

var listener = function() { Ti.API.info("Event listener called."); }
window.addEventListener('click', listener);

To remove the listener, pass in a reference to the callback function:

window.removeEventListener('click', listener);

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the event.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to remove. Must be the same function passed to addEventListener.

method.shortDoc: Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...

method.name: setBoolean
method.doc: Calls a method taking a single boolean argument on a view in the remote view hierarchy. See Android's documentation for setBoolean.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the view to invoke the method on. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: methodName
params.doc: Name of the method to call.

params.name: value
params.doc: Value to pass to the method.

method.shortDoc:
Calls a method taking a single boolean argument on a view in the remote view
hierarchy. ...

method.name: setBubbleParent
method.doc: Sets the value of the bubbleParent property.

params.name: bubbleParent
params.doc:
New value for the property.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0

method.shortDoc: Sets the value of the bubbleParent property. ...

method.name: setChronometer
method.doc:
Sets the base time, format string, and started flag for a chronometer in the remote view hierarchy.

@description

See Android's documentation for setChronometer.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the Chronometer to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: base
params.doc: Time at which the timer would have read 0:00.

params.name: format
params.doc: Chronometer format string, or null to simply display the timer value.

params.name: started
params.doc: True if you want the clock to be started, false if not.

method.shortDoc:
Sets the base time, format string, and started flag for a chronometer
in the remote view hierarchy. ...

method.name: setDouble
method.doc:
Calls a method taking a single double argument on a view in the remote view hierarchy.

@description

See Android's documentation for setDouble.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the view to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: methodName
params.doc: Name of the method to call.

params.name: value
params.doc: Value to pass to the method.

method.shortDoc:
Calls a method taking a single double argument on a view in the remote view
hierarchy. ...

method.name: setImageViewResource
method.doc:
Sets the image for an image view in the remote view hierarchy using an Android drawable resource.

@description

See Android's documentation for setImageViewResource.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the ImageView to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: srcId
params.doc: Resource ID of the new image. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

method.shortDoc: Sets the image for an image view in the remote view hierarchy using an Android drawable resource. ...

method.name: setImageViewUri
method.doc:
Sets the image for an image view in the remote view hierarchy using a URI.

@description

This method supports supports both Android and Titanium URLs.

See Android's documentation for setImageViewUri.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the ImageView to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: uri
params.doc: URI of the image (both Android and Titanium URLs are supported).

method.shortDoc: Sets the image for an image view in the remote view hierarchy using a URI. ...

method.name: setInt
method.doc:
Calls a method taking a single int argument on a view in the remote view hierarchy.

@description

See Android's documentation for setInt

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the view to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: methodName
params.doc: Name of the method to call.

params.name: value
params.doc: Value to pass to the method.

method.shortDoc: Calls a method taking a single int argument on a view in the remote view hierarchy. ...

method.name: setLayoutId
method.doc: Sets the value of the layoutId property.

params.name: layoutId
params.doc: New value for the property.

method.shortDoc: Sets the value of the layoutId property. ...

method.name: setLifecycleContainer
method.doc: Sets the value of the lifecycleContainer property.

params.name: lifecycleContainer
params.doc:
New value for the property.

@platform android 3.6.0

method.shortDoc: Sets the value of the lifecycleContainer property. ...

method.name: setOnClickPendingIntent
method.doc:
Launches a Titanium.Android.PendingIntent when the specified view is clicked.

@description

See Android's documentation for setOnClickPendingIntent.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the view to add a click listener to. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: pendingIntent
params.doc: The PendingIntent to execute when this view is clicked.

method.shortDoc: Launches a Titanium.Android.PendingIntent when the specified view is clicked. ...

method.name: setPackageName
method.doc: Sets the value of the packageName property.

params.name: packageName
params.doc: New value for the property.

method.shortDoc: Sets the value of the packageName property. ...

method.name: setProgressBar
method.doc:
Sets the progress, max value, and indeterminate flag of a progress bar in the remote view hierarchy.

@description

See Android's documentation for setProgressBar.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the progress bar to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: max
params.doc: The new maximum value of the progress bar.

params.name: progress
params.doc: The new progress value of the progress bar (from 0..max).

params.name: indeterminate
params.doc: Determines whether the progress bar is indeterminate. If true, the progress bar displays an infinite looping animation.

method.shortDoc:
Sets the progress, max value, and indeterminate flag of a progress bar in the
remote view hierarchy. ...

method.name: setString
method.doc:
Calls a method taking a single String argument on a view in the remote view hierarchy.

@description

See Android's documentation for setString.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the view to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: methodName
params.doc: Name of the method to call.

params.name: value
params.doc: String to pass to the method.

method.shortDoc:
Calls a method taking a single String argument on a view in the remote view
hierarchy. ...

method.name: setTextColor
method.doc:
Sets the text color of a view in the remote view hierarchy.

@description

See Android's documentation for setTextColor.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the view to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: color
params.doc: Color as an integer.

method.shortDoc: Sets the text color of a view in the remote view hierarchy. ...

method.name: setTextViewText
method.doc:
Sets the text of a text view in the remote view hierarchy.

@description

See Android's documentation for setTextViewText.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the text view to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: text
params.doc: New text for the text view.

method.shortDoc: Sets the text of a text view in the remote view hierarchy. ...

method.name: setUri
method.doc:
Calls a method taking one URI on a view in the remote view hierarchy.

@description

See Android's documentation for setUri.

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the view to update. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: methodName
params.doc: Name of the method to call.

params.name: value
params.doc: URI (as a string) to pass to the method.

method.shortDoc: Calls a method taking one URI on a view in the remote view hierarchy. ...

method.name: setViewVisibility
method.doc:
Sets the visibility of a view in the remote view hierarchy.

@description

See Android's documentation for setViewVisibility

params.name: viewId
params.doc: Resource ID of the view to show or hide. Application-specific resource IDs can be specified using Titanium.App.Android.R.

params.name: visibility
params.doc: The visibility. Either 0 (VISIBLE), 4 (INVISIBLE) or 8 (GONE).

method.shortDoc: Sets the visibility of a view in the remote view hierarchy. ...
